1.title: React Introduction and Environment Setup
1.description: Learn React framework core concepts and modern development environment setup

theory.content: React is a JavaScript library developed by Facebook for building user interfaces. It adopts a component-based development approach and achieves efficient interface updates through the Virtual DOM mechanism. React's core features include: component architecture, declarative programming, unidirectional data flow, and a rich ecosystem.
keyPoints: Component-based development - Break down interfaces into independent, reusable components
Virtual DOM mechanism - Maintain virtual DOM tree in memory to optimize real DOM operations
Declarative programming paradigm - Describe what the interface should look like, not how to manipulate it
JSX syntax sugar - Write HTML-like syntax in JavaScript
Unidirectional data flow - Data flows from parent to child components, maintaining predictable application state

practice.title: Environment Setup Practice
practice.description: Hands-on React development environment setup, create your first React application
practice.problem: Create a simple personal introduction card component that includes name, profession, avatar, and contact information. Use function components and props for data passing.

project.title: React Project Scaffolding Tool
project.description: Build an automated React project creation tool to help developers quickly set up React project environments
features: Pre-configured ESLint and Prettier code standards
Integrated common development dependencies and tools
Automatic generation of project documentation and README
Built-in routing and state management configuration

projectValue.title: Value of React Project Scaffolding Tool in Projects
projectValue.description: As a core development tool for projects, enables automated React project creation, reducing project initialization time from hours to minutes, providing development teams with standardized development environments and efficient engineering experiences.

3.title: React Event Binding
3.description: Master React's event handling mechanism to implement user interaction functionality

theory.content: React uses the SyntheticEvent system to provide a consistent cross-browser event handling experience. Event binding uses camelCase naming and is bound through JSX attributes. React's event system features: cross-browser compatibility, event delegation mechanism, preventDefault and event bubbling control.
keyPoints: React event binding syntax: on + EventName = { event handler }
Event handlers can receive event object parameters
Support for passing custom parameters and event objects

practice.title: React Event Handling Practice
practice.description: Master various event handling techniques through practical examples
practice.problem: Create an interactive counter component with requirements: 1. Display current count value 2. Click + button to increase count 3. Click - button to decrease count 4. Click reset button to clear 5. Double-click count display area to also reset

project.title: Interactive Game Interface
project.description: Develop a simple click game showcasing React event handling capabilities

projectValue.title: Value of Interactive Game Interface in Projects
projectValue.description: As the core implementation of user interaction features, demonstrates complete application of React event handling, providing users with smooth interactive experiences and enhancing product user engagement and retention.
